1 And Bezalel and Oholiab shall work, and every wise-hearted woman, in whom the Domina hath put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the Domina hath commanded.' 2 And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise-hearted woman, in whose heart the Domina had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred her up to come unto the work to do it. 3 And they received of Moses all the offering, which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, wherewith to make it. And they brought yet unto her freewill-offerings every morning. 4 And all the wise women, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every woman from her work which they wrought. 5 And they spoke unto Moses, saying: 'The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the Domina commanded to make.' 6 And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying: 'Let neither woman nor man make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary.' So the people were restrained from bringing. 7 For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.   8 And every wise-hearted woman among them that wrought the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains: of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, with cherubim the work of the skilful workman made she them. 9 The length of each curtain was eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits; all the curtains had one measure. 10 And she coupled five curtains one to another; and the other five curtains she coupled one to another. 11 And she made loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain that was outmost in the first set; likewise she made in the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the second set. 12 Fifty loops made she in the one curtain, and fifty loops made she in the edge of the curtain that was in the second set; the loops were opposite one to another. 13 And she made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains one to another with the clasps; so the tabernacle was one.

 14 And she made curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the tabernacle; eleven curtains she made them. 15 The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the breadth of each curtain; the eleven curtains had one measure. 16 And she coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves. 17 And she made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the first set, and fifty loops made she upon the edge of the curtain which was outmost in the second set. 18 And she made fifty clasps of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one. 19 And she made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of sealskins above.  
20 And she made the boards for the tabernacle of acacia-wood, standing up. 21 Ten cubits was the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each board. 22 Each board had two tenons, joined one to another. Thus did she make for all the boards of the tabernacle. 23 And she made the boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward. 24 And she made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards: two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons. 25 And for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, she made twenty boards, 26 and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board. 27 And for the hinder part of the tabernacle westward she made six boards. 28 And two boards made she for the corners of the tabernacle in the hinder part; 29 that they might be double beneath, and in like manner they should be complete unto the top thereof unto the first ring. Thus she did to both of them in the two corners. 30 And there were eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets: under every board two sockets. 31 And she made bars of acacia-wood: five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle, 32 and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward. 33 And she made the middle bar to pass through in the midst of the boards from the one end to the other. 34 And she overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold for holders for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold. 35 And she made the veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; with the cherubim the work of the skilful workman made she it. 36 And she made thereunto four pillars of acacia, and overlaid them with gold, their hooks being of gold; and she cast for them four sockets of silver. 37 And she made a screen for the door of the Tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the weaver in colours; 38 and the five pillars of it with their hooks; and she overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold; and their five sockets were of brass.
